src_text: Phethagat o ya mananeo a bohlokwa a mmu o Kabinete e amoget e go saenwa ga dikwano t e 26 t a boleng bja R94 bilione nakong ya Ketelo ya bjale ya Semmu o ya Mopresidente Xi Jinping wa Chin Dikwano t e di saenet wego di akaret a R12 bilione ya go aga polante ya t welet o ya difatanaga ka Afrika Borwa, kadimo ya US$500 go Eskom ya tlhabollo ya mananeokgoparara le thekgo ye e nago le tii elet o ya US$billone go Transnet go t wa go Panka ya Tlhabollo ya ChinBjalo ka karolo ya Foramo ya bo2 ka ga T homi ano ya China-Afrika (FOCAC), Mopresidente Xi Jinping o neelane ka US$60 bilione ya tlhabollo ka AfrikKamogelo ya Pego ye mpsha le Leanotiro (2016-2018) go FOCAC e tla kopanya kamano ye e golago ya kwano gare ga Afrika le China, yeo e tlogo bulela menyetla ye meswa ya kgwebi ano le peelet o go thu a go tso a kgolo ya ekonomEkonomi gape e amoget e thekgo ya ekonomi ge Sehlopha sa BMW ya Afrika Borwa se tsebi a peelet o ya R6 bilione polanteng ya yona ya Rosslyn, Pretoria, yeo e hlatselago kamano ye bohlokwa yeo e lego gona gare ga kgwebo le mmu o, le karolo yeo kgwebo e e bapalago hlabollong ya ekonom Ka Labobedi, 8 Manthole, Mopresidente Zuma o abet e badudi ba maAfrika Borwa le badudi ba dinagadi ele bao ba kgathilego tema kaonafat ong ya botho Difoka t a Boset hab Difoka t a Boset haba ke sebaka sa segolo sa boitekolo, keteko le boikgant ho bja batho ba gaboren Ba keteka phihlelelo ya botho, boikgafo bja botho le maiteko a botho ao a dirago naga ya rena go ba ye kaon Kabinete e ipilet a go maAfrika Borwa ka moka go
trg_text: Implementation of key government programmes Cabinet welcomed the signing of 26 agreements to the value of R94 billion during the recent State Visit by Chinese President Xi Jinpin The signed agreements included R12 billion to build a car-manufacturing plant in South Africa, a US$500 million loan facility to Eskom for infrastructure development and a US$billion funding guarantee for Transnet from the China Development Ban

trg_text: Cabinet approved for South Africa to host the high level Anti-Drugs Dialogue Conference from 11 to 12 March 2016, which will be under the auspices of the African Unio This serves as a follow-up session of the Russia-Africa Anti-Drugs Dialogue, which aims to present a consolidated position regarding countering the world drug proble This will be tabled at the UNGA Special Session in April 2016.

src_text: Afrika Borwa e tla emelwa ka gare ga Lekgotla la Mokgatlo wa Bodit habat haba wa t a Mawatl Se ke kgato ye kgolo go ya go temogong ya bokgoni bja naga le kontinente ka lekaleng la t a MawatlMokgatlo wo o rwelego maikarabelo a go amogela diphetho ka ga merero ya t a mawatle ya lefase, go tloga go Ekonomi ya Mawatle, diprot eke t a pholo o le polokego le ditabana t a t hirelet o ka lewatlenGo kgathatema ka mokgatlong wo go tla thekga lenaneo la mmu o la go bulela bokgoni bja t a mawatle bja naga ka Leano la Ekonomi ya Mawatle ya Blue/Blue Oceans Economy Strategy le Operation Phakisa, t eo maikemi et o a t ona e lego go hlola me omo ya ka godimo ga ye milione o tee ka 2033. .
trg_text: South Africa will be represented in the Council of International Maritime Organisatio This is a major step towards realising the country and the continent s potential in the maritime secto The organisation is responsible for adopting decisions on global maritime affairs, ranging from the Oceans Economy, rescue initiatives and safety and security matters at se The participation in this body will support government s programme of unlocking the country s maritime potential through the Blue Oceans Economy Strategy and Operation Phakisa, which aims to create over one million jobs by 2033.

trg_text: Cabinet approved the rationalisation of magisterial districts for Limpopo and Mpumalanga, and the designation of the Lephalale Magistrate s Court as a local seat of the Limpopo Division of the High Court, as an interim measure until a separate permanent local seat of the Division is built in the areThe rationalisation of magisterial districts and areas of jurisdiction of the Divisions of the High Court is part of the policy reform aimed at redressing the legacy of spatial injustices of the pas It is also part of the broader transformation imperative to enhance access to justice, which is aligned to the Constitution of the Republic of South Africa of 1996. .

src_text: Kgoro ya Maphelo, ka t homi ano le Soul City le Times Media, e thakgot e t hanele ye e lebanego fela le maphelo le mokgwa wa go phela Good Life Network (Neteweke ya Bophelo bjo bo Botse) mo go t hanele ya 199 ya DSt T hanele e aba metheriale wa kga o wa go fapana, ya go thabi a le ye e lego ya mono gae ka tlhago ka ga phepo, maphelo le tekanelo, ditokelo t a botho, t a thobalano ya baswa, HIV le TB, gape le ditokelo t a moreki le t a bon Kabinete e ipilet a go maAfrika Borwa gore a lebelele t hanele Diphetho t e bohlokwa t a Kabinete Kabinete e dumelet e kgati o ya Pegosemmu o ka ga In orense ya Boset haba ya Maphelo (NHI) ya Afrika Borwa, gore go dirwe ditshwayotshway NHI ke karolo ya diphetogo t e kgolo t a lekala la maphelo t a mmu Pholisi e
trg_text: million tax returns received for non-provisional taxpayer This is 1 per cent higher than in 2014, and the compliance for taxpayers filing on time exceeded 90 per cent for the third consecutive yea This high level of compliance enables government to deliver services that improve the quality of life of all its citizen During this festive period, government is implementing various campaigns which require all South Africans and visitors to play their part in ensuring that the festive period is enjoyed in a safe and secure environmen Cabinet calls on all to work with the South African Police Service and to report any criminal activities in our homes and communitie In order to accommodate the influx of cross-border travellers, all government departments at ports of entry will from 10 December 2015 to 14 January 2016 extend their operating hour These include Health, Agriculture, Police, Home Affairs and South African Revenue Service).

trg_text: Key Cabinet decisions Cabinet approved the publication of the White Paper on the National Health Insurance (NHI) for South Africa, for public commen The NHI is part of government s major health sector reform The policy proposes government s ability to offer medical services to all who visit its health facilitie It will be funded through a central fund that will also be made available to private medical practitioners who want to participate in the schem Once finalised, the policy will be phased in over the years and focus mainly on commencing in underserviced area The Minister of Health, Dr Aaron Motsoaledi, will today brief the media on the roll-out of the NH

src_text: et ana kudu go thoma mafelong ao a sa fiwego ditirelo ka tshwanelTona ya Maphelo, Ngaka Aaron Motsoaledi, lehono o tla begela bobegaditaba ka ga thakgolo ya NH Kabinete e amoget e Pholisi ya Boset haba ye e Kopant wego ya Kgolo ya DigotlanPholisi e ngwadilwe ka go boledi ana le bakgathatema ba go fapana ka gare ga lekal E ahlaahlilwe ke set haba ka Dibokwane 2015.Pholisi ye e kopant wego ya ECD e tla kgonthi i a gore digotlane ka moka le bahlokomedi ba t ona ba kgona go fihlelela ditirelo t a ECD t a boleng bjo bo tlet ego go tloga mathomong go fihla go Kreiti

src_text: Pholisi e oket a tirelo go akaret a bana ba mengwaga ye seswai ba ba nago le mathata a kgol Gape pholisi e fa tlhako ya tlhokomelo le tekodi i o le tshekatsheko go kgonthi i a gore e phethagat wa ka tshwanelo go bana ka moka ntle le mmala, bong goba tumel Kabinete e dumelet e Pegosemmu o ka ga Ditokelo t a Bagolofadi le Metrikse wa phethagat o ya yon Se se sepelelana le Diphegello t a Tlhabollo ye e Swarelelago ye e akaret ago bogolofadi, ye e amoget wego ke Seboka sa Kakaret o sa Dit habakopano (UNGA) ka Lewedi 2015.Pholisi e tla akgofi a phetogo le toki o mabapi le kakaret o ka botlalo, kopanyo le tekatekano ya bagolofad Kabinete e amoget e kgati o ya Pholisi ya Boset haba ya Kelelat hila gore go dirwe ditshwayotshway Pholisi e bea boitekanelo bja batho bogare bja tlhabollo ka go lekana gare ga go aba methopo ya matlotlo go thekga dipeelet o ka maemong a godimo a tirelo, go aba ditirelo go malapa ao a sa abelwego ka tshwanelo, mola gape e hlokomela le go tso olo a mananeokgoparara a kelelat hila a a lego gon Kabinete e amoget e go tli wa Palamenteng ga Pego ya Lebakanyana ya bo5 ya Afrika Borwa (2009-2014) ka ga Phethagat o ya Kwano ka ga Phedi o ya Mehuta ka Moka ya Kgethollo kgahlanong le Basad Pego e fa kakaret o ka ga katlego ya molokeloke wa melao, dipholisi le mananeo ao a phethagadit wego le dihloa t a diphihlelelo t a naga ka ga matlafat o ya basadi le tekatekano ya bon Pego gape e amogela gore go na le ditlhohlo t e di t welago pele le mapheko go fenya go se lekalekane le kgethollo ka gare ga nag Kabinete e amoget e kgati o ya Sengwalwa sa Leanotiro la Boset haba go Thibela Semorafe, Kgethollo ya semorafe, Lehloyo la Bafaladi le Go se Amogelane wo o amanago nawo, gore o dirwe tshwayotshwayLeanotiro ke leano la boset haba le le kopant wego le beakant wego le maikemi et o a lona e lego go thibela semorafe le go aga Afrika Borwa ya temokrasi ye e sa hlaolego go ya ka morafe le bonLe fa tlhako ya magato a a swarelet ego le a beakant wego go ka t ewa ke naga ka bophara go
trg_text: Cabinet approved the report on progress regarding the implementation of the Cabinet directives in Limpopo in terms of Section 100 (1) (a) of the Constitutio Cabinet approved the withdrawal of Section 100 (1) (a) by 31 March 2016 in the following Limpopo provincial departments: Health; Transport; Public Works; Roads and Infrastructure and TreasurCabinet also approved the conditional withdrawal of Section 100 (1) (a) in Education to pave the way for the Provincial Treasury to effectively implement Section 18 of the Public Finance Management Act, 1999 (Act 1 of 1999) in the Limpopo Department of Education, with support from national governmenCabinet approved the following directives to the Premier and the MECs for Finance and of Education:a) Capacitating the provincial departments by recruiting competent personnel;b) Finalising the appointment of senior management positions; andc) Dealing decisively with leadership failure and corruptio .

src_text: ogana le kgethologanyo ya semorafe le bomorafSe se thu a Afrika Borwa go kgotsofat a maikarabelo a yona a boset haba, selete le bodit habat haba, kudu Pego ya Durban le Lenanetiro le le amoget wego ke UN Khonferenseng ya kgahlanong le Bomorafe ka 2007.
trg_text: Cabinet approved the publication of the Draft National Action Plan to Combat Racism, Racial Discrimination, Xenophobia and Related Intolerance, for public commen The plan is an integrated and systematic national strategy aimed at combating racism and building a truly non-racist and non-sexist democratic South AfricIt provides a framework for sustained and coordinated measures to be undertaken by the country as a whole to deal with the legacy of racism and racial discriminatio This assists South Africa to meet its international, regional and national obligations, specifically the Durban Declaration and Programme of Action adopted by the UN at the World Conference against Racism in 2001.

src_text: Kabinete e tsebi it we ka kgatelopele ka ga lenaneo la phetogelo go dit ital E amoget e go thoma ga lebaka la pont hodipedi bakeng sa siknale ya kga o ya dit itale ka Afrika Borwa ka la 1 Dibokwane 2016.Phetogelo go t wa go analoko go ya go ditirelo t a kga o ya dit itale e lokolla spekteramo sa palo ya maphoto a radio ye e nyakegago kudu ye e lebanego kabo ya ditirelo t a metato ya kgokagano ye e thetag Se se tla oket a phadi ano ya ekonomi ya Afrika Borwa ka go tso olo a intasteri ya kga o, go matlafat a intasteri ya bot welet i bja seilektroniki, go hlola me omo, le go t welet a metheriale wa kga o wo mont i wa selegae le ya kga o ya go fapan Kabinete e tsebi it we ka ga dikutullo t a Pego ya Ditaet i t a Afrika Borwa t a Saense, Theknolot i le Boithomelo ya 2014 le mekgwa ka tiragat ong ya Sestemo ya Boset haba ya Tlhamo ye Mpsha, ye e t welet wago ngwaga ka ngwaga ke Lekgotlakelet o la Boset haba ka ga BoithomelPego e

trg_text: Being the last Cabinet meeting for 2015, Cabinet extends its best wishes to all South Africans for the upcoming festive seaso In the spirit of the season and in keeping with the spirit of Ubuntu, Cabinet calls on all South Africans to assist needy individuals and families in their communit We are a nation that cares for one another, respects each other and supports those who are less fortunat The coming New Year offers all of us the possibility to recommit ourselves to work for a better future for al 6.
